H0.text: The warm object loses energy and the cool object gains energy so that both objects stay at different temperatures when a warm object is put inside a cooler object.

H1.text: The warm object gains energy and the cool object loses energy so that both objects stay at different temperatures when a warm object is put inside a cooler object.

H2.text: The warm object loses energy and the cool object gains energy until both objects are the same temperature when a warm object is put inside a cooler object.

H3.text: When a warm object is put inside a cooler object, the warm object gains energy and the cool object loses energy until both objects are the same temperature.

A4.text: net the hotter transferring energy to the cooler, and will exchange equal and opposite amounts just when they are at the same temperature

A5.text: if bodies are prepared with separately microscopically stationary states, and are then put into purely thermal connection with each other, by conductive or radiative pathways, they will be in thermal equilibrium with each other just when the connection is followed by no change in either body
